normalised: Hey Bollywood buffs! Film festivals are buzzing again, and this time it's not just Cannes hogging the spotlight. The Chennai International Film Festival just wrapped up, showcasing some real gems from indie filmmakers. Word on the street is that Priya Sharma's debut film, "Kadambari," walked away with a special jury mention. But the festival circuit doesn't stop there! Preparations are in full swing for the Kolkata International Film Festival later this year. Rumor has it they are planning a special section dedicated to Satyajit Ray's influence on modern cinema. And let's not forget the regional fests! From Kerala's focus on world cinema during Onam, to smaller, more intimate festivals celebrating specific genres, there's something for every cinephile. So ditch the Netflix binge for a weekend and explore the magic of film festivals near you. Maybe you'll discover the next big thing over a plate of delicious Hyderabadi biryani at the festival canteen! Just saying!
